intro: Althaea remotiflora, commonly known as the distant-flowered marshmallow, is a herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its tall, hairy stems and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its roots produce a mucilaginous substance. Althaea remotiflora typically grows in wet or marshy habitats and is often found in moist meadows and along riverbanks.
